title: The Hidden History of America At War
teaser: On Memorial Day, Americans honor those who have fallen in wars and conflicts since the beginning of the nation's history. But how well do our narratives of how these wars unfolded match reality? John Munson's guest historian says there are many less simple truths behind the image of 'a noble and unflinching America at war.' He discusses those complications, which include racism and torture. Plus, he explains why he says thanking our soldiers is not the same as honoring them.
